Files

file  bsputils_tiler.h
 Tiler allocator API.
 

Macros

#define BSPUTILS_TILER_CPU_VIRT_ADDR   (0x60000000U)
 Tiler CPU virtual address.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_PHYS_MEM_SIZE   (128U * MB)
 Tiler physical memory size.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_CNT_8BIT   (0U)
 Indicates 8-bit tiled.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_CNT_16BIT   (1U)
 Indicates 16-bit tiled.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_CNT_32BIT   (2U)
 Indicates 32-bit tiled.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_CNT_MAX   (3U)
 Indicates number of tiled types (8-bit/16-bit/32-bit)
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_COPY_TO_DDR   (0U)
 Indicates direction – copy to DDR.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_COPY_FROM_DDR   (1U)
 Indicates direction – copy from DDR.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_ORI_NONE   (0x00U)
 Indicates normal orientation.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_ORI_X_FLIP   (0x01U)
 Indicates horizontal-flipped orientation.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_ORI_Y_FLIP   (0x02U)
 Indicates vertical-flipped orientation.
 
#define BSPUTILS_TILER_ORI_XY_SWAP   (0x04U)
 Indicates horizontal and vertical flipped orientation.

Detailed Description

Function Documentation

UInt32 BspUtils_tilerAddr2CpuAddr ( UInt32  tilerAddr)

Convert tilerAddr to CPU addr.

Parameters
tilerAddr[IN] address got via BspUtils_tilerAlloc
Returns
CPU virtual address
UInt32 BspUtils_tilerAlloc ( UInt32  cntMode,
UInt32  width,
UInt32  height 
)

Alloc from tiler space.

Value can be passed directly to VPDMA

Parameters
cntMode[IN] container mode
width[IN] width in BYTES
height[IN] height in lines
Returns
Tiler address
Int32 BspUtils_tilerCopy ( UInt32  dir,
UInt32  tilerAddr,
UInt32  dataWidth,
UInt32  dataHeight,
const UInt8 *  ddrAddr,
UInt32  ddrPitch 
)

Copy between tiler Address space and non-tiler DDR address.

This API internally converts tilerAddr to cpuAddr

Parameters
dir[IN] BSPUTILS_TILER_COPY_TO_DDR or BSPUTILS_TILER_COPY_FROM_DDR
tilerAddr[IN] tiler address returned during BspUtils_tilerAlloc() or BspUtils_tilerGetAddr()
dataWidth[IN] data width in bytes
dataHeight[IN] data height in lines
ddrAddr[IN] Non tiled DDR address
ddrPitch[IN] Pitch to be used for data in non-tiled space in bytes
Returns
FVID2_SOK on sucess, else failure
Int32 BspUtils_tilerDebugLogEnable ( UInt32  enable)

Enable/disable debug log for tiler APIs.

Parameters
enable[IN] Indicates whether the debug log is to be enabled
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success else failure
Int32 BspUtils_tilerDeInit ( void  )

De-initialize the tiler.

Returns
FVID2_SOK on success else failure
Int32 BspUtils_tilerFrameAlloc ( Fvid2_Format *  pFormat,
Fvid2_Frame *  pFrame,
UInt16  numFrames 
)

Allocate a frame in tiler space.

Use FVID2_Format to allocate a frame. Fill FVID2_Frame fields like channelNum based on Fvid2_Format

Parameters
pFormat[IN] Data format information
pFrame[OUT] Initialzed Fvid2_Frame structure
numFrames[IN] Number of frames to allocate
Returns
FVID2_SOK on success, else failure
Int32 BspUtils_tilerFreeAll ( void  )

Free all previously allocated tiler frames.

Returns
FVID2_SOK on success else failure
UInt32 BspUtils_tilerGetAddr ( UInt32  cntMode,
UInt32  startX,
UInt32  startY 
)

Get tiler Address.

Parameters
cntMode[IN] container mode
startX[IN] X-coordinate in BYTES
startY[IN] Y-coordinate in LINES
Returns
tiler address
UInt32 BspUtils_tilerGetOriAddr ( UInt32  tilerAddr,
UInt32  cntMode,
UInt32  oriFlag,
UInt32  width,
UInt32  height 
)

Get tiler address after applying the orientation.

Parameters
tilerAddr[IN] 0 degree tiler address returned during BspUtils_tilerAlloc().
cntMode[IN] Container mode.
oriFlag[IN] Orientation flag representing S, Y', X' bits
width[IN] 0 degree buffer width.
height[IN] 0 degree buffer height.
Returns
Tiler address after applying the necessary orientation.
Int32 BspUtils_tilerInit ( void  )

Initialize the tiler.

Returns
FVID2_SOK on success else failure
